Reviews.Title: Excellent phone!
Reviews.Author: Iggy White
Reviews.Content: This little phone is a marvel. It has most of the bells and whistles much more expensive phones have but for fraction of their price. Also, it has the latest Sense 3.5 layered over Android 2.3.5. User interface is therefore first class. You will learn how to use it in no time.There's a lot of applications built in: web browser, navigation, social networking, Google search, address book with deep integration with all your contacts across various media, audio and video players and recorders, Android market, calendar and organizer, e-mail clients, etc.Connectivity is brilliant: Bluetooth 3.0, GPS, several modes for connecting to your PC, Wi-Fi, micro USB. GSM connectivity covers most bands: quad-band 2G and dual-band 3G. Also, the phone is fully unlocked, unbranded, SIM-free; you can check the software information to prove that (software revision/build number is *.401.*).Build quality is surprisingly good for this price range, mixture of aluminum and rubberized body give a sense of holding much more expensive device in your hand. Battery life could definitely be better, but it's not a deal-breaker.The response is snappy, considering the hardware inside. Screen is very good and clear, and covers almost whole front face of the phone. Camera is of modest quality. Audio quality is good. Video playback is limited, but this is not what this phone is really made for. Memory is big enough for several additional applications/gadgets and there's a microSD slot if you need more space.To summarize - there are definitely better phones out there. But not for this price. All in all, this was one of my best investments ever (and I have much more expensive phones to compare it with). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: US Buyers Beware - 3G doesn't work! Not enough internal memory.
Reviews.Author: mercyshipper
Reviews.Content: There are two main problems with this phone.  If you're going to be using data in the U.S., I couldn't ever find a way to get 3G working, so your fastest speed will be Edge.  But the other problem is even worse - there's only 130MB of internal storage, which fills up so incredibly fast, even if all of your apps are on your SD card.  It's awful, and it's constantly telling me I don't have enough memory.  I keep clearing my cache and it doesn't help.  Probably won't be long until Android starts crashing due to the lack of internal memory.  Apart from that, it works well and is a reliable phone.

Reviews.Title: Hot, small package
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Bates "Niccho"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone on a whim with minimal research. I was umming and aaagghing about getting an iphone but kept balking at the cost especially as I had an ipod already which I use constantly for listening to podcasts, wi-fi at home and the office, and reading books. So what did I need in a phone I finally asked myself? Phone, email and internet. Occasionally a camera and the option of reading a book if I am without my ipod. The Explorer jumped out of me in the first shop I went into after I had decided not to go down the iphone path at present. I liked the look of it including its robust rubber casing, the size and most of all the price. So just like that I bought it, and within a day of using it and realising just how much it did, I was hooked. Its easy to use even for an android beginner like me. No, its not an iphone 4S or a Samsung Galaxy but it is proof that for under $200 (and what did that buy you in the phone department five years ago? Not much) you can join the world of smart phones and embrace all the mobile technology that the everyman/woman needs.  On the basis of having owned this phone for less than a week, but having operated it in two countries, I could not be happier with my spontaneous purchase and count myself as a new fan of HTC phones.27 February. Have now had the phone about a month. Still enjoying it but it does have some issues - for example it can sometimes take a long time to 'load' which can be annoying if you need to make a phone call in a hurry. I have even had the situation where the phone was ringing but the usual swiping process to answer the phone just didn't work! Music player is nothing to write home about and no challenge to your everyday ipod.  So, with that I am revising my rate down from 5 stars to 4.

Reviews.Title: An honest take
Reviews.Author: Sesa
Reviews.Content: I got my new phone about a month ago, didn't rush in to review the item until a decent amount of time had passed. The price is very accomodating I will start by saying that, I like small phones, and I like smart phones, couldn't put it any other way. The reason I approached this device was because I wanted to move up from my Samsung Galaxy Mini. With this said, I clear out the fact that this is not my first experience with an android phone, and surely some comparisons will be made in this comment.  The size is very comfortable, at least for me, it fits in my hand the screen is ok, and if I can't read something, I can just easily customize it, zoom, and get it bigger. I'm not the most tech savy person but I know my decent share of phones, the principle is this, if you buy it you should be able to use it, to do the basics......make calls, receive texts, and use the internet.  The android market has alot of good apps for this phone, no complaints there. Colors are very good, more than you'd expect, camera....meh, didn't buy this for the camera, but it works in daylight. Its a plus to be able to put live wall papers on my backround, my old phone dind't have this.  I was afraid I wouldn't be able to sync this new phone because it wasn't samsung with my galaxy tab, but since they both run on android systems, I am able to use it just the same, and sync my contacts my calendar and all with it.I preffer this phone in so many different ways, size, more modern, and faster internet app than the old one I had, but.....And this is very important. It's not dummy proof.What do I mean, by saying this. When your internal memory is full, there is absolutely no way you will be able to use your phone. It won't let you make calls, it won't let you text, it won't let you open the internet. I totally understand phone storage, but if you can't even make a call, or open the dialer (if you were hipothetically in an emergency situation) you would be in big trouble. I actually do not appreciate that, it took me a while to find the place where you had to clear app data, or put some of it into the memory card....Still doesn't excuse not being able to make a call.All in all, it's a good phone, I didn't feel a huge leap from the one I had already, only minor improvements, but they are still different brands. It's cheap, and it seems quite versatile, not looking for luxury, more something that can give me the simple needs, it takes on hard falls I'll tell you that :) which makes it a great phone for people who aren't too carefull. I'm sure, maybe there are more uses to the phone I have yet to unlock, but for now, this is what I have on it.

Reviews.Title: Memory? What Memory?
Reviews.Author: W. Corey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone based on price, size, Android system, past satisfaction with HTC products, & data compatibility with the African markets. Upon initial inspection I was quite pleased, but when put into full time service it turned to be quite disappointing. The looks, feel, battery performance, & network compatibilities are just fine. The main problem is the available storage (up to 90MB per [...]). I am having trouble believing this as I have only loaded 4 applications internally for a total of 17MB, & the system reads only 6MB memory remaining. I assumed this could be overcome with an external sd card, but found that very few applications will transfer to or run from the card.  The company specs read 512MB RAM, this should be plenty, but again falls short. At least 4 to 5 times a day the phone locks up during operation & resets itself, often I must pull the battery to reset. Typically after every reset there is a warning issued `Internal Storage is Low, Please remove some applications to free system'. I follow this link & choose option of `Move apps to SD card', the resulting reply is `Nothing to move'. Again I ask, where is the memory?  Reviewed after 3 weeks of use.

Reviews.Title: HTC explorer
Reviews.Author: Rudolph
Reviews.Content: Love the phone. Fantatic responses. However, you must be careful when talking with the phone  against the ear as the slightest touch will make the call drop. Beautiful colours and resolution.On the negative side not happy with the battery. The battery barely last through the day. It is very very disappointing. Also, for a sophisticated phone such as this,  NO handsfree set was supplied. This is a shame, as phones that are much cheaper comes with a handsfree  bundled.  Overall I can give a 3 out of 5,

Reviews.Title: Internal Problem
Reviews.Author: Christopher S. Parrish
Reviews.Content: Phone was great but the main problem I had was people would say when I was talking it sounded as though I was 20ft away sometimes and they couldnt hear me. So I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: A very good smartphone vs price
Reviews.Author: Rudolph Glen
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best smartphone price wise you can find, I recently purchased this phone and it has so many features that come along without the need to install anything else; it has mail (to check all email accounts), it has people app (to manage all your contacts, syncing with facebook, gmail, yahoo, etc, so that you don't have to add any contact you know; it has a built-in gps, so that you know where you are and what is near you at all times. It also has a music player, camcorder, camera, calendar an many more.However I must say that the internal memory is an issue since it only supports a storage of 90Mb to install apps; as a counter measure you can insert a 32Gb micro SDHC to extend storaga capacity, but not all apps can be install on the micro SD. As a side note the 3MP camera is not very good under poor lighting conditions, keep that in mind if you're planning to use this phone as your main photo device.Finally, the phone came out in perfect shape, everything that was "in the box" came as it was stated; I totally recommend this smartphone, specially since its price is so competitive! Very good job HTC!

Reviews.Title: nice unit
Reviews.Author: Pavel C "CanonMan"
Reviews.Content: First, one star is gone due to the seller eXpansys, Inc. who shipped me European model charger, and threw in an adapter to work in US system.  Lame.  If one has to get grey market units to sell them cheap here, this is not cool.  It works, but now the charger is effectively two times larger since the adapter is a part of it.Other than that, the phone is awesome, it works very well, just like several reviews here and elsewhere state, sound is very clear, reception is good, WiFi works solid, and the Android OS on it runs nice and fast.  You can watch you-tube videos and whatever you want, it works very well for a small device.Scrolling is smooth and fast, games and apps work like they should.Bottom line, there is nothing negative about the phone itself, a definite keeper.  Very sensitive screen, seems that it picks up fingers before they even touch the device, but it seems to be tamed to being just right once screen protector is placed on it.  So it works beautifully now.For an entry level phone, this is one feels like a top of the line unit in a smaller package.  And if I need a bigger screen, there is a tablet for that.  Or use a regular desktop if you must go larger.Buy one! The Android market is growing rapidly, leaving iPhone less and less market share.  It is obvious.

Reviews.Title: Nice small form factor Android Phone
Reviews.Author: Martin Evans
Reviews.Content: I use a Sprint HTC EVO 4G while in the USA, but needed a small, cheap GSM Android phone to roam with internationally.  I tried several, but this one was by far the best.  The  screen is small, but very bright, responsive and plenty big enough to use.  It is fast (unlike some others), and seems to have plenty of memory.  It runs all the apps I need perfectly well.  The multi-touch screen is very responsive.  This is a well thought out, low budget offering by HTC.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for light use.
Reviews.Author: michael.stirrup
Reviews.Content: I drowned my previous HTC explorer (fishing!) and was quoted $80 if it could be repaired. Much better to buy a new one here for the same price that leaves me with a backup battery and power cord as well. Delivered quickly and everything as expected but memory limitations as I experienced with the old one make this phone only appropriate for light use.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but low internal memory
Reviews.Author: Paola Castellanos
Reviews.Content: It's ok. It's a good phone. But it has very low internal memory. So there's a couple of extra stuff you need to do in order to gain memory for apps.

Reviews.Title: a sturdy basic smartphone
Reviews.Author: Irene
Reviews.Content: It's been a year now, since I've bought this phone and i love it. The only concern - out of memory issue. I have moved all the apps that can be moved to an SD card, but some still have to be installed locally. I have the bare minimum - maps, Gtalk and OfficeSuite, but once in a while i still get a message that i m running out of memory.Other than that it serves all the basic needs, works fine abroad (i took it to Russia) and have not had any glitches yet (knock on wood). It's also very user friendly and as an Android fan i love it (did i say that again?).

Reviews.Title: Worst Phone, bad decision, Not good response from HTC
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for based on price, size and past reviews of HTC products. The appearance and battery performance,  are just fine. The main problem is its internal storage, which fills up so incredibly fast, even if all of your apps are on your SD card. I constantly get a message that there is not enough memory. I keep clearing my cache and it doesn't help.I put in an 8 GB microSD card but many apps cannot be loaded onto/transferred to the SD card. There is a huge flaw in the phone.No useful response from htc support team. Their only answer is to delete useful apps. I have already deleted a few apps, just have facebook, whatsapp and viber. There is no way to move  data or bloatware from HTC. I've not found any solution for this memory problem. At least 10 times a day  there is a warning issued `Internal Storage is Low, Please remove some applications to free system'. When I follow this link and choose option of `Move apps to SD card', the resulting reply is `Nothing to move'. Find a phone with more internal memory, preferably not an htc.

Reviews.Title: Seven months later...
Reviews.Author: C. Reyes
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone mainly for the value. I was in the middle of a service contract and needed a new phone. This one sufficed for the time being. Memory isn't an issue for me since I bought a 16GB memory card for it. I have simple needs. I use it mainly for calls, text, and as an mp3 player. I've had a few hiccups along the way, but they weren't too much to handle. One thing that bothered me was the screen size. It's fine for everything else, but typing is a bit of a challenge. Other than that, it's a decent phone.

Reviews.Title: Cute Affordable Phone
Reviews.Author: Maise888 "Chicago888"
Reviews.Content: This is a good back-up or starter phone to have. Easy to use and compact. There is not a lot of memory in this baby, but it will do. Bought it from Hasslefreecell. They were amazing! The phone was shipped in 3 business days. Unfortunately, I am unable to use this phone to its full potential as this phone does not support the 3G 1700 mhz waveband that Simple Mobile ONLY uses. It still works with that carrier, but do not expect 3G speeds !!! I would recommend this phone for someone on a budget or for a first Android phone. I bought this phone as a back-up phone.

Reviews.Title: really good phone
Reviews.Author: andriod new
Reviews.Content: This phone as inexpensive and I am surprise how well it works. It's fast and its as good as any other $400 phone, but it actually fits in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Grandfather joins the Smartphone Generation
Reviews.Author: Duane C. Beck
Reviews.Content: I decided to get a Smartphone and wanted an unlocked version to activate on my Consumer Cellular account. Researched and compared and decided on this one.Consumer Cellular shipped me a replacement SIM for my old phone. Installed in the Explorer and activated it. Had a problem with the message service but found a great free Android App: "Tweakker" at the Google Play store. Downloaded and installed, selected my network, Consumer Cellular, and the app set up my phone correctly. Still learning but have found many free apps that make my life much simpler and I now can message my GrandKids. Would recommend this for all those hesitating to join the Smarphone community. No contract is a great benefit and this phone fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Bolo4040
Reviews.Content: Great service, product came as expected, brand new. I just put in my sim card, powered it on and i was on my way. I've had it or 2 months now and everything still works very well. I really wish HTC would have build a led light into it but, other than that its all good.

Reviews.Title: HTC Explorer
Reviews.Author: mtLuke
Reviews.Content: Needed a replacement for my Samsung and wanted a bit of an upgrade from my Solstice.Did a bunch of research and decided the Explorer was my best option under $150.Phone came sooner than expected, charger was European with an adapter. Thank goodness we're all using a universal plug now. The phone is setup for India using English language, Weather updates were set to Bangalore,Mumbai,etc.Wasn't too hard to change all that and get it configured for my liking.So far after having it for just about two weeks I'm finding I'm really enjoying it, The Android system works great but takes a little getting used to how to access things.HassleFreeCell was easy to deal with and shipped promptly, got phone in 3 days from Florida.Phone was brand new with all paperwork and packaging, had it up and running in a few minutes.Would buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: Perfect travelling phone
Reviews.Author: John Haselsberger
Reviews.Content: I got this for going to Europe. It is unlocked so any local SIM will work. I got a SIM with a minimal data plan for a good price, so I can call and text and respond to emails with ease. It has all the android smartphone goodies like GPS so I installed a GPS app with downloadable maps (so I dont need to eat up data, as the default google maps requires) so I also have a nifty pocket GPS with local maps and POI's wherever I am. Added the google voice app, so I can even make totally "free" calls to/from the USA whenever I am in a strong WiFi area (it stutters with weak WiFi, and would eat up my data plan if I used that) wherever I happen to be. Reasonable (but not outstanding) bettery life. Nice phone.

Reviews.Title: Way to Go
Reviews.Author: REviewer
Reviews.Content: The price was very reasonable for an unlocked android smartphone. Phone worked right out of the box... even had a decent charge! I've used the phone with pay-as-you-go sim cards in the US and abroad. Phone has everything one could need in a smartphone, including hotspot capability! Fast shipping... good packaging from the seller. The way to go is a unlocked smartphone such as this one.

Reviews.Title: Good Economical Phone
Reviews.Author: Naveed Bhopal
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone a month ago. It is a great phone, with Android Gingerbread version. The applications run much faster than my previous Samsung Galaxy Gio. It is also compact.The only issue I found is that Skype does not work correctly on HTC Explorer. Although, it meets minimum requirements for Skype, but due to some reason, the audio is terrible, and cuts off. The only workaround I found was to use handsfree, but even that doesn't always work.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: rodo
Reviews.Content: Phone is very good, camara is not that well but rest of the stuff is good.Size is what I was looking for, and is really confortable.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Joan B Hemmings Ximines
Reviews.Content: Value for money.

Reviews.Title: Greate European style phone
Reviews.Author: Mr. P
Reviews.Content: Phone works fine and good buying experience.4 * for not mentioning that this is European version, this phone requires a small adapter to be inserted into the US receptacle.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: cshack
Reviews.Content: Nothing special but a real nice phone.Would be better if it had more storage but if you keep your eye on memory use it works great.

Reviews.Title: Please don't buy any item from this seller. Very bad Product quality and Customer Service.
Reviews.Author: Samuel A.
Reviews.Content: I bought this HTC Explorer A310e Unlocked GSM Phone as a gift for my Mom. She started using the phone on December 6th,2013. Within couple of days they noticed the display to be flickering and displaying nothing. This issue occurs frequently and they had to remove the battery and place it again for it to work again. Unfortunately my parents are in India so I won't be able to return the phone to Amazon. I contacted the Customer Service to check if they would be able to help, they just replied asking me to take the phone to a repair shop to get it repaired... Grrrrr. I'm not sure what they mean by Amazon A-Z guarantee. The display costs as much as the phone itself so no point spending more money on this defective phone. I should have thought and bought this phone from a genuine dealer. Guys, please spend some extra bucks and buy from a genuine dealer. Please don't buy and regret as I do.

Reviews.Title: HTC
Reviews.Author: J. G. Samuels
Reviews.Content: I bought this for client of mine and she is happy with it so far. Takes great pics and runs smooth. HTC products are always good. Oh! its factory unlocked too..works in Belize

Reviews.Title: A good phone for $90 bucks
Reviews.Author: PAul
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement.  We had a POS Samsung from Cincinnati Bell. That phone was the worst thing we ever owned! This HTC seems to be built to last. It is small. Dont plan on rocking a lot of video.  However, it is an Andriod and I think my wife likes it. It feels sturdy too. We bought it unlocked. All we had to do was insert the SIM card.  It took about 2min to get it all set up. Very nice! I would give it 4-stars but the internal memory will eventually be an issue.

Reviews.Title: Makes my mom happy
Reviews.Author: Shel20284
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my mom. Even though its a little behind, she is loving it. When got it, I was talking to her, she was listening but wasn't hearing a word am saying. Makes me happy

Reviews.Title: Cheap Smart phone
Reviews.Author: beka
Reviews.Content: For me it was the best choice, maybe it's not as powerfull as other expensive phones, but with this price or even +30$ you can't find better one.

Reviews.Title: only Chinese manual ???
Reviews.Author: Hsuei-Ling YU
Reviews.Content: Got the phone today. All the manuals are in Chinese!Come on, why do you assume that we all can read Chinese.Will return it the first thing in the morning.Todd

Reviews.Title: Great Phone but small memory
Reviews.Author: Natasha Brady
Reviews.Content: Great phone. I bought it for Jamaica and it does everything with the exception that it keeps saying internal memory is low. When I try moving some of the apps, it says there is nothing to move. Otherwise, it's a great phone. Just need to figure out the internal memory!

Reviews.Title: Cool phone
Reviews.Author: Raul Soto "soto3sa"
Reviews.Content: The phone is very small but easy to manipulate. Excellent screen resolution, in fact, I think it looks  awesome for a phone this cheap! It works smoothly and without hiccups. Even though the on screen keyboard appears tiny, it is very responsive and, at least in my experience, accurate in its response. I am not a heavy user, so my review might not work for all of you. After a few more days of use, I'll comment about battery life. So far it lasts almost 2 days but again, I am not a heavy user. I decided to buy this phone because my experience with HTC is without complains. I also own an HTC Flyer tablet and works perfectly as well. Recommend this phone 100%.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: FBB
Reviews.Content: I got the phone cos I was looking for something cheap I could Instagram and keek on while on the road since I had a blackberry and an iPad. Well, the phone is okay but horrible camera which defeats the purpose while I got it.

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Good :)
Reviews.Author: Bianca L.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone back in mid September of last year & I must say it was a great budget buy. I had been looking for a phone that would be suitable for light to moderate daily use, and a phone that would be more so on the smaller side; I found it in this HTC Explorer. (I did a huge amount of research before purchasing, as I was choosing between this and the Samsung Galaxy Y) I'd heard from tech savvy friends that HTC was more reliable as opposed to Samsung, although I do like both ;)I've rated it 4/5*s because even though it is a powerful little gadget, it has force closed on me more than a few times. I can only guess that it was probably due to having multiple apps running simultaneously.Since September, my clumsy hands have dropped this little phone several, and I do mean SEVERAL, times; but in spite of it all, it has survived without a scratch......until last week, when during a thunderstorm, I accidentally dropped it, only having it land face down on concrete. There's a single, diagonal break in the glass screen on the bottom right corner about an inch in length, so I assume it wasn't reinforced in any way.The battery life is good, not horrible, not excellent. I charge it nightly so it does pretty well for a whole day. Storage isn't that great anymore & that's with my 16gb sd card in it.All in all, I wouldn't change my 4 stars because I'm not a heavy user & don't need a "latest generation" phone. This HTC Explorer does the trick for me!

Reviews.Title: I was not expected the dimension of the phone as i see it
Reviews.Author: karamo kargbo
Reviews.Content: I was thinking that this phone have a front camera and much more stuffs that let me to buy it but it really sucks because is a small phone and the battery can serve me a day so i decided to return it but any way i love HTC product not this phone doh.

Reviews.Title: love the phone but HATE the built-in memory issues
Reviews.Author: Chance Briggs
Reviews.Content: I really have liked this phone - small and (with a rubber case) quite rugged and it seemed like good value for money.The killer problem  is that the built-in memory isn't enough to load more than a few apps. I put in an 8 GB microSD card but many apps cannot be loaded onto/transferred to the SD card.  To me, this is a huge flaw in the phone, and in the end I've had to switch to another phone because of this problem

Reviews.Title: Good unlocked phone
Reviews.Author: Khushbu
Reviews.Content: I liked the phone.Touch sensitivity is high.Good battery life.This Unlocked HTC piece is best offered phone for the price.

Reviews.Title: The worst phone ever.
Reviews.Author: pin
Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone i have ever baught.It is not GSM compatable as was advertised.I baught the international madel and now that i take it to my country it does not work with any GSM net work.I think these phone should be taken off the market and I should get a refound.

Reviews.Title: Everything is amazing except the internal memory
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: I purchase this phone mainly because of the price. It was evident to me that it will do everything the other smart phhones were doing except it wouldn't cost me that much. The androd soft-ware system is incredible and I'm never bored with my phone. The camera is not amazing but then again it is acceptable given the price of the phone. The thing I hate most about this phone is the internal memory. I enjoy playing games and using other apps but if the app can't be transfer to my sd card I don't even waste my time to download. I'm constantly having to uninstall apps because the phone constantly says my internal memory is low so for my social networks namely facebook I have to uninstall because even to load pictures require too much memory. The memory bothers me tremendously because I went to buy a 16gb memory card and even with that I'm not afforded the opportunity to download everything I want because not all apps can be transfered to the card.... I feel like a kid in a candy store (android app store) and can only get 2 scoops of ice cream (apps) because the cone is too small (internal memory of the phone). But other than the memory problem I love my phone....

Reviews.Title: Very awesome phone
Reviews.Author: jane
Reviews.Content: this phone is very a beautiful, small, sensitive, high tech phone. don't believe all those bad reviews, this phone is so great,and the internal storage is ok too

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: J. Nieves
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent phone! It has a large, bright, clear screen and isn't bulky to carry or hold. I like that when I push buttons it vibrates, making me feel like it's a real button. There's no need to buy a protective skin for it because the back and sides are already rubberized, a nice feature. Good camera with decent zoom capability. This is my first touch phone and I'm glad I chose this one. I'm still getting used to all the features it has but I do everything I need to easily, which is exactly what I needed. VERY glad with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: dont be fooled by the price
Reviews.Author: BlueFishTattoos
Reviews.Content: Phone has little or no internal memory. Cannot update most apps (or even download new ones. Right now I have to fiddle with app memory just to view my photos. Save up and get a better phone with at least 2gb internal memory.

Reviews.Title: amazing phone
Reviews.Author: estelle G.
Reviews.Content: writing this because i read a lot of reviews before buying anything. so let`s start by stating that i LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE this phone. i ordered it and it came in like three days early, everything was in the box, warranty, cable to connect to computer and to the wall socket.1- the touch screen is very responsive ,no lagging works perfect2- wanted an android, that is ability to buy stuff from the market and this phone has what i needed.3-the lock screen just amazes me( personal liking here)4- the volume during calls is perfect and it has options to ring louder when its in your bag and the volume gets low when you grab it.5- great picture and has picture effects already set up. black n white, sepia and all that.6- comes with 2 Gb memory card in the phone why i did not give it 5 stars1- it has Indian apps in the phone that i do not use, take space and are not uninstallable(bummer)2- the space of the phone is not that big since the Indian apps already takes a lot of space but you can adjust this with a bigger memory card.so pros and cons..weigh them..no seriously if you want a great android phone for under $200 and that fits right in your hand order NOW. you`ll love it.

Reviews.Title: Crappy Product
Reviews.Author: J. Oyesiji
Reviews.Content: Worst Amazon product i ever bought, I turned on this phone and all it showed was the htc logo, Really disappointed!!! Buy at your own risk

Reviews.Title: IS THERE A WARRANTY ?
Reviews.Author: M. NICOLAU "MRMNBLEEP"
Reviews.Content: HTC EXPLORER  NO INFO PER WARRANTY.PLEASE EXPLAIN  ALSO WHATS IN THE BOX REALLY NEED MORE INFO FOR A $150.01  IS IT NEW ?  awaiting second reply
